repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Ghana Micro, Small and Medium
            Enterprise Project (MSME) aims to enhance the competitive
            and employment levels of Ghanaian MSMEs. Credit proceeds
            will be re-allocated to reflect the newly agreed scope of
            the project. The original amount of the credit will be
            reduced by ten million US dollars (equivalent to SDR 6.931
            million) and cancelled from the credit. The partial
            cancellation amount will be re-committed to the general
            International Development Association (IDA) pool for Ghana
            and towards support for fast moving projects. Project
            outcomes are unchanged; however, the outcome indicators are
            being modified to better reflect the revised scope of the
            project. The changes in the results framework include: a)
            transforming the Project Development Objective (PDO)
            indicators into a set of Specific, Measurable, Attributable,
            Relevant and Time-bound (SMART) indicators which reflect the
            intentions and content of the original PDO; b) consolidating
            and revising a number of indicators to ensure they are
            relevant and clearly defined; c) dropping a number of
            indicators that appear to be of little relevance to the
            revised project, and/or lack data sources; and d) two
            separate lists of indicators. The project will be extended
            for 18 months and the new closing date for project is June
            30, 2013.
